title: 13.3 - The hospital - hv12
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor havo en vwo, leerjaar 1 en 2. Dit is thema 13 'Health and welfare'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: The hospital. Deze les gaat over het ziekenhuis, de spoedeisende hulp, huisregels van het ziekenhuis, bezoek aan het ziekenhuis en er worden verschillende medische klachten besproken. In de grammaticaopdracht worden de woorden 'few' en 'little' besproken.

items.content:
The subject of this double period is the hospital.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Have you ever had to go to the accident and emergency department (AE department = EHBO/SEH) of a hospital?
  • Why did you go there?
  • Have you ever visited anyone in a hospital?
  • Who was it? What for?
Step activity aim time
introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 listening
At the hospital		 You can understand a recording about visting the emergency department and answer questions about it. 15
Step 2 reading
Hospital rules		 You can understand a text about hospital rules and answer questions about it. 15
Step 3 vocabulary You can understand and use the vocabulary about injuries and medical problems. 15
Step 4 grammar
Few or little		 You can understand and use few and little. 15
Step 5 speaking
A discussion about medical problems		 You can have a discussion about medical problems. 10
Step 6 writing
An article about hospital rules		 You can write an article about a hospital rules. 15
Step 7 evaluation Reflecting on what you have learnt. 05

At the hospital

You are going to listen to six people talking to the receptionist of the AE department of a hospital.

  • Listen to the recording and do assignment 1.
  • Listen again and do assignment 2.
  • Read the questions.
  • Listen again and do assignment 3.

Assignment 1

Download the worksheet and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Worksheet: 13.3 The hospital - Listening
Maak een kopie van het werkblad in je eigen omgeving (Bestand - Een kopie maken...) of download het werkblad (Bestand - Downloaden als).​

prompt.body: What injury or problem is the person describing?

items.content:
Questions

  1. What is the problem of the first patient?
  2. Why is he still able to write?
  3. What was the second patient doing when she had her accident?
  4. Why does the third patient think he has got a concussion?
  5. What are the symptoms?
  6. How long has the fourth patient been ill?
  7. What was the fifth patient doing when he got hurt?
  8. How long has he had the pain?
  9. What happened to the sixth patient?
  10. Who is going to help her?

prompt.body: What is the problem of the first patient?
Why is he still able to write?

content.body: He is right handed and hurt his left wrist.
He is left handed and hurt his right wrist.

prompt.body: What was the second patient doing when she had her accident?
Why does the third patient think he has got a concussion?

content.body: He was hit by a horse.

prompt.body: What are the symptoms?

content.body: He has a headache and feels sick.
He ha a stomach ache and wants to throw up.
He has a fever and feels nauseous.

prompt.body: How long has the fourth patient been ill?

content.body: She has been ill since last night.
She has been ill since two days.
She has been ill since this morning.

prompt.body: What was the fifth patient doing when he got hurt?
How long has he had the pain?

content.body: He has had the pain for about two days.
He has had the pain for about an half hour.
He has had the pain for a couple of hours.

prompt.body: What happened to the sixth patient?
Who is going to help her?

items.content:
Hospital rules

You are going to read the house rules for visitors of the Bronovo Hospital in The Hague.

  • Do assignment 1.
  • Read the text.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Download the worksheet and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

Worksheet: 13.3 The hospital - Reading
Maak een kopie van het werkblad in je eigen omgeving (Bestand - Een kopie maken...) of download het werkblad (Bestand - Downloaden als)

Text: Hospital rules

Smoking
Smoking is prohibited in this hospital. The only area in which smoking is permitted is in the smoking area opposite the mortuary on the ground floor and on De Orangerie terrace under the smoke umbrella and under te smoke umbrella outside at the front of the hospital, 30 metres to the left of the main entrance (as you leave the building).

Use of mobile phone
Loud ring tones and alarms could be confused with alarms on medical equipment, and as mobile phones emit electromagnetic signals, they could also interfere with medical devices. If you need to make a call or send a text message, make sure that you go to an area where mobile phone use is allowed. Ask a member of staff at the hospital if you are unsure where you can use your mobile phone.

Visitors
In order to ensure the patients rest as much as possible, generally no more than two visitors per patient are allowed at one time.

MRSA Bacteria
With regard to our policy on preventing MRSA infections, it is important that you let us know if you have been in hospital in another country within the last twelve months.

prompt.body: What is the general rule about smoking in the hospital?

content.body: Smoking is bad for your health.
Smoking is bad for the patients.

prompt.body: How many smoke areas are there inside the hospital?
Where is the smoke area outside the hospital?

content.body: 30 metres left of the  main entrance.
30 metres right of the main entrance.
30 metres left of the back entrance.

prompt.body: What problems do ring tones give?

content.body: They can make medical equiment fail.
They can make the same noise as medical equipment.

prompt.body: What other problems do mobile phones give in hospitals?

content.body: They can make medical equipment unreliable.

prompt.body: Are you allowed to use your mobile phone in the hospital?

content.body: Yes, in some parts of the hospital you can use them.
Yes, you can use them everywhere.
No, it's not allowed to use them in the hospital.

prompt.body: What should you ask the medical staff?

content.body: If use can your mobile phone.
Where you can use your mobile phone.
When you can use your mobile phone.

prompt.body: Why are only two visitors per patient allowed?

content.body: To make sure the patients get well.
To make sure the ward isn't too crowded.
To make sure the patients have enough rest.

prompt.body: What policy does the hospital have concerning MRSA Bacteria?

content.body: They want to cure people with MRSA.
They want to make sure there is no MRSA.

prompt.body: What information about the last twelve months should you give to the hospital?

content.body: If you have been in a foreign hospital.
If you have been in an other hospital.

items.content:
Weet je wanneer je 'few' en wanneer je 'little' gebruikt?
Maak de volgende oefening en kijk of je het verschil tussen 'few' en 'little' begrijpt.

Is je score de eerste keer nog geen 100% doe de oefening dan opnieuw.
Ga door tot je alle vragen goed hebt.

Succes!

items.content:
A discussion about medical problems

Discuss where you have to go in case of the medical problems below. Motivate your answers.

Should you go to:

  • the emergency department of a hospital
  • the GP
  • somewhere else

Medical problems:

  • a headache
  • a broken arm
  • a twisted ankle
  • a tooth ache
  • a cold
  • a fever
  • a concussion
  • dizzyness
  • a stomach ache
  • nausea

An article about hospital rules

You have read an article about the hospital rules of the Bronovo hospital. Now you are going to write an article about those hospital rules.

  • Introduce the subject. (Use the text: Hospital rules).
  • Do you think these hospital rules are reasonable (=redelijk)?
  • Would you add anything?
  • Would you leave a rule out?

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

What have you learnt in this double period?

Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?
